content.body: In terms of the C++/Rust memory model, SharedArrayBuffer's UNORDERED ordering is just an ordinary read or write, right? (Assuming the platform doesn't need locks to write a value of that size in a single operation.) And not Relaxed.
my understanding is that in the C++/Rust memory model, "ordinary" reads and writes to a shared buffer, even if fine by the platform, can lead to compiler optimizations that might still mess things up
I think relaxed will do the right thing
